title: 5 vessels - mass of vaporized I2 to solid

content.question: At 127°C, the entire sample of I2 is observed to have vaporized. How does the mass of vessel 5 at 127°C compare to its mass at 27°C?

choices.label: The mass is less, since the I2 is in the vapor phase.
The mass is the same, since the number of each type of atom in the vessel is constant.
The mass is greater, since the I2 will react with N2 to form NI3 , which has a greater molar mass.
The mass is greater, since the pressure is greater and the particles have a higher average kinetic energy.

content.answer: The mass is the same, since the number of each type of atom in the vessel is constant.

skill.text: 4.C: Explain the connection between particulate-level and macroscopic properties of a substance using models and representations.
